items.title: Awesome Selfhosted
items.content_text:
### Software / Analytics

*   [ghstats (‚≠ê156)](https://github.com/vladkens/ghstats) `‚ö†` - Dashboard for tracking GitHub repos traffic history longer than 14 days. `MIT` `Docker`

### Software / Automation

*   [BookBounty (‚≠ê234)](https://github.com/TheWicklowWolf/BookBounty) `‚ö†` - Retrieve missing Readarr books from Library Genesis. `MPL-2.0` `Docker`

### Software / Communication - Custom Communication Systems

*   [SAMA](https://samacloud.io) - Next-Gen self-hosted chat server and clients. ([Demo](https://app.samacloud.io/demo), [Source Code (‚≠ê122)](https://github.com/SAMA-Communications/sama-server), [Clients (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/SAMA-Communications/sama-client)) `GPL-3.0` `Nodejs/Docker`

### Software / Miscellaneous

*   [Wakupator (‚≠ê145)](https://github.com/Gibus21250/Wakupator) - Wake On LAN Machine Manager based on network traffic. `MIT` `C`

### Software / Status / Uptime pages

*   [kener](https://kener.ing/) - Status page with incident management, easy to use and customize. ([Demo](https://kener.ing/), [Source Code (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/rajnandan1/kener)) `MIT` `Nodejs/Docker`

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:
### JSON Forms / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-formly (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/ngx-formly/ngx-formly) - JSON powered / Dynamic forms for Angular.
*   [formio (‚≠ê681)](https://github.com/formio/angular) - JSON powered forms for Angular.
*   [fluent-form (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/fluent-form/fluent-form) - Building dynamic form in Angular with Fluent API or JSON.
*   [jsonforms (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/eclipsesource/jsonforms) - Customizable JSON Schema-based forms with React, Angular and Vue support out of the box.
*   [jsonforms-angular-seed (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/eclipsesource/jsonforms-angular-seed) - Angular-based JSON Forms seed app.
*   [ng-formworks (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/zahmo/ng-formworks) - An Angular [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/) Form builder, similar to, and mostly API compatible with, [Angular Schema Form](http://schemaform.io/examples/bootstrap-example.html), [React JSON Schema Form](https://rjsf-team.github.io/react-jsonschema-form/), and [JSON Form](https://ulion.github.io/jsonform/playground/).

### Validation / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-reactive-form-class-validator (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/abarghoud/ngx-reactive-form-class-validator) - A lightweight library for dynamically validate Angular reactive forms using [class-validator (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/typestack/class-validator) library.

### Misc Components / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-compile (‚≠ê90)](https://github.com/patrikx3/angular-compile) - Angular Dynamic Compile. Convert strings to Angular components.
items.content_html:
JSON Forms / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-formly (‚≠ê2.9k) - JSON powered / Dynamic forms for Angular.
  • formio (‚≠ê681) - JSON powered forms for Angular.
  • fluent-form (‚≠ê50) - Building dynamic form in Angular with Fluent API or JSON.
  • jsonforms (‚≠ê2.5k) - Customizable JSON Schema-based forms with React, Angular and Vue support out of the box.
  • jsonforms-angular-seed (‚≠ê37) - Angular-based JSON Forms seed app.
  • ng-formworks (‚≠ê5) - An Angular JSON Schema Form builder, similar to, and mostly API compatible with, Angular Schema Form, React JSON Schema Form, and JSON Form.

Validation / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-reactive-form-class-validator (‚≠ê24) - A lightweight library for dynamically validate Angular reactive forms using class-validator (‚≠ê11k) library.

Misc Components / Google Developer Experts

  • angular-compile (‚≠ê90) - Angular Dynamic Compile. Convert strings to Angular components.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Bayesian Modeling / Generative Model

*   [Analysis of Langevin Monte Carlo via Convex Optimization](https://www.jmlr.org/papers/v20/18-173.html) - ***Journal of Machine Learning Research***, 2019. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=5305860199396047317)]. This paper provides new insights on the Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm. The authors show that this method can be formulated as the first order optimization algorithm for an objective functional defined on the Wasserstein space of order $2$. Using this interpretation and techniques borrowed from convex optimization, the authors give a non-asymptotic analysis of this method to sample from log-concave smooth target distribution on $\mathbb{R}^d$. Based on this interpretation, the authors propose two new methods for sampling from a non-smooth target distribution. These new algorithms are natural extensions of the Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics (SGLD) algorithm, which is a popular extension of the Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm for largescale Bayesian inference. Using the optimization perspective, the authors provide non-asymptotic convergence analysis for the newly proposed methods.
items.content_html:
Bayesian Modeling / Generative Model

  • Analysis of Langevin Monte Carlo via Convex Optimization - Journal of Machine Learning Research, 2019. [All Versions]. This paper provides new insights on the Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm. The authors show that this method can be formulated as the first order optimization algorithm for an objective functional defined on the Wasserstein space of order $2$. Using this interpretation and techniques borrowed from convex optimization, the authors give a non-asymptotic analysis of this method to sample from log-concave smooth target distribution on $\mathbb{R}^d$. Based on this interpretation, the authors propose two new methods for sampling from a non-smooth target distribution. These new algorithms are natural extensions of the Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics (SGLD) algorithm, which is a popular extension of the Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm for largescale Bayesian inference. Using the optimization perspective, the authors provide non-asymptotic convergence analysis for the newly proposed methods.
